verbs.description: underrepresent (third-person singular simple present underrepresents, present participle underrepresenting, simple past and past participle underrepresented)

entries.meaning: To represent something as being lower or smaller than is the case.
To give something insufficient or inadequate representation.
examples: Kessler […]  said that he decided to run for alderman because he felt that Triplett underrepresented the ward.
